subject: RE: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: Here s a thought then. If J.B. will write the don t case, then I ll consider writing the do case. I can t start until this weekend at soonest, but I would
messageBody:
Here's a thought then. If J.B. will write the "don't" case, then I'll consider writing the "do" case. I can't start until this weekend at soonest, but I would be willing to put my thoughts in writing.

Simon

>-----Original Message-----
>From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, June 04, 2002 11:50 AM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: RE: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods,
>even if one
>or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
>
>
>> Good plan. Then we can get back to discussing important issues, like
>> whether we should test ALL accessor methods! :-)
>
>Grrrrr...
>
>> But seriously ... while the FAQ is being updated, can we get the
>> accessor method issue addressed the same way in the FAQ? Something
>> along the lines of "test or don't test the accessor methods, it's
>> your choice!" :-)
>
>As long as I get a hand in arguing the "don't" case. Perhaps
>for the last
>time! Wouldn't that be great?
>
>--
>J. B. Rainsberger,
